trade_captain.narrative: The Trade Captain notices your climbing gear. 'Ah, properly equipped I see! There's a mountain pass that cuts the travel time in half. Dangerous without the right gear, but you seem prepared...'

workshop_master.narrative: The Workshop Master examines your climbing equipment with approval. 'Good quality gear. With that, you could take the mountain pass to Crossbridge. Much faster than the main road, if you're not afraid of heights.'

logger.narrative: The Logger grins. 'You've been good to us here. The logging crews built a cart road through the forest - not many outsiders know about it. Tell them I sent you if anyone asks.'

herb_gatherer.narrative: The Herb Gatherer leans in conspiratorially. 'The loggers have a private road they use for hauling timber. Since you've helped me so much, I'll mark it on your map.'
The Herb Gatherer sees your compass. 'Good, you have navigation tools. There's an old forest trail I use for gathering. Stay on the path and watch for the marked trees.'

tavern_keeper.narrative: The Tavern Keeper draws you a rough map on a napkin. 'Travelers who can't afford the main road sometimes use the forest trail. Just be careful - easy to get lost without proper tools.'

dock_master.narrative: The Dock Master strokes his beard. 'You've proven yourself reliable. There's a path that follows the river - fishermen use it. Shorter than the trade highway if you don't mind getting your boots wet.'

camp_boss.narrative: The Camp Boss points toward the river. 'With that compass, you could follow the river route to Crossbridge. We send workers that way sometimes. Just don't stray from the riverbank.'

dock_master.narrative: The Dock Master looks at your equipment and whistles low. 'Both climbing gear AND navigation tools? There's a dangerous route through the rapids that only experienced travelers attempt. You might just manage it...'

logger.narrative: The Logger sizes you up. 'That climbing gear looks sturdy. There's a direct path over the mountain back to Millbrook. Steep as hell, but it'll save you hours.'

marcus_thornwood.narrative: Marcus notices your climbing equipment. 'For urgent deliveries, some of us use the direct mountain path. Since you've been so reliable with my letters, I'll show you where it starts.'
